alert.note: Alert for Schleicher; Sutton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 11:25PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of far southwestern Schleicher and northwestern Sutton Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1125 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles northwest of Sonora, moving rapidly east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Us-277 Near The Sutton-Schleicher County Line, I-10 Near The Crockett-Sutton County Line and The Intersection Of I-10 And Ranch Road 1989. This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 380 and 398. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for west central Texas.
